deep-protac.name: Deep Protac
deep-protac.description: Standard PROTAC prediction model for general protein degradation applications
deep-protac.details: The base PROTAC model provides predictions for protein-ligand interactions and optimal linker configurations for a wide range of protein targets.

diff-protac.name: Diff PROTAC
diff-protac.description: Specialized for cancer-related protein targets including KRAS and MYC
diff-protac.details: The Diff PROTAC model is fine-tuned for cancer-related targets with special emphasis on previously undruggable oncogenes.

docs.title: Research Papers
docs.description: Scientific publications related to this model

protac-neuro.name: Neuro PROTAC
protac-neuro.description: Optimized for neurological targets including tau protein and Œ±-synuclein
protac-neuro.details: The Neuro PROTAC model focuses on protein targets relevant to neurological disorders, with special consideration for blood-brain barrier penetration.

docs.title: API Documentation

docs.title: Neurological Target Guide

protac-advanced.name: Advanced PROTAC Designer
protac-advanced.description: Full-featured PROTAC design platform with custom linker optimization
protac-advanced.details: The Advanced PROTAC Designer provides comprehensive tools for novel PROTAC creation with exceptional customization options.

docs.title: Live Preview Setup
docs.description: Learn how to enable and use live 3D rendering.

docs.title: Custom Output Config
docs.description: Set up preferred export formats and endpoints.

protac-interactive.name: Interactive PROTAC Studio
protac-interactive.description: A flexible workspace for custom input/output workflows including 3D structure generation
protac-interactive.details: Interactive PROTAC Studio offers an advanced interface for multi-input experiments, enabling researchers to input sequences, ligands, linker preferences, and choose output formats like 3D models or raw data.
features: Multiple text field inputs (e.g., protein sequence, ligand SMILES, linker length)
Customizable output formats (text summary, JSON, or 3D model file)
Live 3D structure preview or downloadable model (e.g., PDB format)
Integrated input validation and structure-based suggestions
